titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Unidentified individual's personal account book 1978_127
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-08-25 13:41:42 +0000.

did.unittitle: Unidentified individual's personal account book (collection to be reassessed)
did.abstract: Account book of an unidentified individual for the period 1891 to 1922, containing lists of expenditures related to various products, services, and interests, organized by month. Annual and cumulative financial statements are also included. The the pre-printed pages of the volume indicate that it originally belonged to the Illinois Central Railroad Company, though no financial information relating to the Railroad is included.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Unidentified individual's personal account book, 1978_127, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1978.
